**Release Candidate Testing Guide** - Follow these steps to manually verify the release candidate before promoting to final v0.1.0 release.

## ğŸ“‹ Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:

<Checklist>
  <Checklist.Item>Devcontainer set up and running</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Supabase local instance accessible</Checklist.Item>

## ğŸš€ Step 1: Start Development Environment

### What to Test
Verify the one-command startup works correctly.

<Steps>
  <Steps.Step>
    **Open terminal in devcontainer**
  </Steps.Step>
  
  <Steps.Step>
    **Run the start command**:
    ```bash
    bun run start
    ```
  </Steps.Step>
  
  <Steps.Step>
    **Watch for these messages**:
    ```
    ğŸš€ Starting Gello development environment...
    âœ… Supabase started (or already running)
    ğŸŒ± Seeding database with test data...
    âœ… Database seeded successfully
    ğŸš€ Starting development server...
    Server will be available at: http://localhost:3000
    ```
  </Steps.Step>
</Steps>

### âœ… Expected Results

<Checklist>
  <Checklist.Item>Supabase starts without errors</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Database seeding completes successfully</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Development server starts on port 3000</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>No error messages in terminal</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Server shows "Server running on http://localhost:3000"</Checklist.Item>
</Checklist>

<Callout type="warning">
  **If Something Goes Wrong**
  
  - **Supabase won't start**: Check Docker is running (`docker ps`)
  - **Seeding fails**: Check Supabase is running (`bun run supabase:status`)
  - **Port 3000 in use**: Stop other services using port 3000
</Callout>

---

All users have password: `password123`

## âœ… Step 8: Run Automated Tests

### What to Test
Verify all automated tests pass.

<Steps>
  <Steps.Step>
    **Run Integration Tests**:
    ```bash
    bun run test:integration -- --run
    ```
  </Steps.Step>
  
  <Steps.Step>
    **Run Unit Tests**:
    ```bash
    bun run test:unit -- --run
    ```
  </Steps.Step>
  
  <Steps.Step>
    **Check Code Quality**:
    ```bash
    bun run check:dry
    ```
  </Steps.Step>
</Steps>

### âœ… Expected Results

<Checklist>
  <Checklist.Item>Integration tests: **119/119 passing**</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Unit tests: **99/99 passing**</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>Biome check: **No errors**</Checklist.Item>
  <Checklist.Item>All tests complete without errors</Checklist.Item>
</Checklist>

<Callout type="warning">
  **If Tests Fail**
  
  - Check Supabase is running: `bun run supabase:status`
  - Reset database: `bun run supabase:reset`
  - Re-run tests
</Callout>
